text.p: Suppose [mathjaxinline]v,w \in \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]\langle v, w \rangle = 5.[/mathjaxinline] What is [mathjaxinline]\langle w, v \rangle[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: If [mathjaxinline]v = \left[ \begin{array}{c} a_1 \\ a_2 \\ \vdots \\ a_ n \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]w = \left[ \begin{array}{c} b_1 \\ b_2 \\ \vdots \\ b_ n \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline], then

tr.td: [mathjax]v\dotprod w = a_1b_1 + a_2b_2 + \ldots + a_ nb_ n = b_1a_1 + b_2a_2 + \ldots + b_ na_ n = w \dotprod v.[/mathjax]

font.p: In other words, the dot product is symmetric, and is a commutative operation.
